Posts.Title: Sad News!
comfortable wigs
Nulasta shot!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Mastectomy

Posts.Content:
I know the hair loss is hard!!!  I waited the first time but then it began to hurt physically as well as emotionally.  The last time I had chemo, I shaved it the first day that it really started falling out - I felt much better - like I was in control of something.  And the wig isn't so bad,  sleep a little later each morning and then get dressed, put on makeup, shake your hair out and then slap it on!!!! Hope you are feeling better about
 this whole business.  Let your husband shave it off - if he's anything like mine - he'll probably enjoy it!!! HA HA
Posts.Title: Hair loss

Posts.Content:
Getting up later in the morning will be nice.  The hair will grow back and you will really appreciate it.  Mine is very curly and cute.  Everyone loves it but not nearly as much as I do.  The first time mine grew back it was a couple of years before it straightened out and it still had a lot of body after 8 years.  You're right - everything has a bright side - more sleep is always a good thing.  Baseball caps, wigs, hats, ... it'll all work out and you'll find what feels comfortable.  I wore a wig because I taught 1st grade.  Of course, one of my students (who lives next door) came over one day and my hubby let her in.  She was surely surprised that Mrs. King had no hair but it wasn't a really big deal to her - she loved her teacher 
 - and she kept my secret until I came back with 1/2 in. hair.  My class quickly got over the shock and were glad to hear I was better now.  It all works out in the end, things we think are huge deals are really small in comparison to what really matters:  friends, family, students (in my case) and doing what we can to live as long as possible!!!
Posts.Title: Hair loss

Posts.Content:
Before I had my second mastectomy and removal of first implant, I was lopsided.  I ordered a prosthetic from Jodee - it's inexpensive (about
 $100) and is advertised as a shell for lumpectomy patients.  It filled out the smaller size so that my bras fit well and I looked even.
Posts.Title: Bra help needed

Posts.Content:
I think it's different for everyone and you'll have to see how things go.  I just began to have fewer and fewer periods until I had none at all.  Took me about
 2 or maybe 3 years in all.
Posts.Title: Ok, so here's a stupid question...
short hair

Posts.Content: I quit having periods during the 5 years I was on Tamoxifen.  My gyn said that they would return after the 5 years but they didn't, so I'm no help.  Just hope that they will get back to normal soon.
Posts.Title: Periods after Tamoxifen???? Question....
kids and chemo
Femura?

Posts.Content: I took Tamoxifen for 5 years.  Yes, I did gain some weight and had hot flashes.  I took Effexor and it really helped the hot flashes.  Prozac also helps.  I'm on Femara now and the Prozac didn't seem to work as well so I'm back on the Effexor and it's working nicely.  I quit having a period after a couple of years on Tamoxifen and that has been nice.  Trust me, it's a lot better than being on chemo.  You'll make it!!!
Posts.Title: I start tamoxifan tomorrow

Posts.Content:
I had 3 positive lymph nodes and finished my 5 years with Tamoxifen.  I didn't start it until almost three years after my first episode with bc because of my age.  After I finished Tamoxifen, my onc put me on Femara but I was immediately diagnosied with a recurrence by blood work.  I am still on the Femara and finished with chemo and doing well.  I would ask about
 the Femara.
Posts.Title: Femura?

Posts.Content:
I had Taxotere.  I had to take cortesteroids to alleviate allergic reaction but still had trouble with swelling in feet and legs and a "full" feeling kind of breathless.  Sometimes worse than others. It's not a good feeling...  As to losing the hair, it's really traumatic but you do learn to deal with it.  Go ahead and cry - it's okay to be upset but remember you're going thru this to get better and it's been done before by others.  We have survived and you will too.  I cried and whined (have to tell the truth) about
 my hair but even my onc didn't know I had on a wig until I told him...You'll learn to put it in perspective when you can.
Posts.Title: Reaction to chemo..loss of breath??

Posts.Content: Well, we got in Sun am at 4:00.  Left on July 14 for State Championship - 15 year old sons team won!!!  It was so exciting.  Went to St. Augustine, FL for a week - so relaxing and peaceful.  Left on the 23rd of July for Seattle - got aboard the Diamond Princess and cruised to Alaska.  It was so nice!!! We did the Glacier Bay, Skagway, Ketchikan, Juneau, etc.  It was so nice being waited on hand and foot!!!  I did miss my 3 boys last week but my sisterinlaw kept them fed.  I go back to work tomorrow.  IT's THAT TIME AGAIN!!! SCHOOL!!!  Praying for a great year.  I saw that we have new members to the board and that Denise is out of pain now.  I never met Denise but I kept up with her reports thru the board.  I hate that we have had to have new members added to this board - hate bc but I'm glad that they found this board  and will have someone to help answer their questions and give support.

AgeInfo.Phrase: July 14 for State Championship   15 year old sons team won

Posts.Title: Back from Alaska
For those you have taken or are currently on Tamoxifen
menapause and breast cancer
Back from Alaska

Posts.Content: I agree with the others - HAVE IT TAKEN OUT!!!  We really don't need anything extra in our bodies anyway.  It's better to be safe than sorry, I say.  I wish all doctors took a more proactive approach to our health!!
Posts.Title: Advice...Suggestions? I have a Complex Sclerosis Lesion

Posts.Content: It is when you begin taking the Tamoxifen.  I didn't begin it until 3 years after my first episode with cancer.  I took it for 5 years after that. I didn't have any trouble with the Tamoxifen except for the hot flashes.  Onc and Gyn both suggested Effexor for the hot flashes and it worked!!!  It's a lot better than chemo and it makes you feel like you are still fighting the ole bc!
Posts.Title: starting Tamoxifen

Posts.Content:
I will say that I wished that I had a bilateral mastectomy in 1996.  That wasn't that common in 96 though.  It surely would have saved me a lot of trouble last year when I had a recurrence on the other side.  I can say that I feel so much better without my old chest (it let me down).  If I had it to do over again, I would have tried my best to have a bilateral.  It's not worth the trouble having to think about
 it constantly.
Posts.Title: Found another lump.....now what?

Posts.Content: That was really neat - I wish I had seen it last year when I was going thru my last episode with bc.
Posts.Title: This is Beautiful

Posts.Content:
I took Tamoxifen for 5 years and had no problems with drug interactions.  You can search on the web for sites that show drug interactions that you don't have to be a member of.  I'm on Femara now but I finally went to a diet doctor to find out what I could take.  She gave me a prescript
ion and then I checked the web also for drug interactions, told my onc.  I take Adipex - took Bontril first.  I've had no problems.  Good Luck.  Onc said to be careful before taking anything off the counter because some of the natural ingredients work like hormones and I was estrogen positive.  So you have to be careful.
Posts.Title: Any drug interactions with Tamoxifen?
Just started rads with week
Finally starting rads

Posts.Content: Well, we leave Thursday for the State Championship for our district in Georgia (school baseball team).  The tournament will be over on Sat, (if we're still in it by then) - then it's off to St. Augustine Beach, FL for a week.  Then, my husband and I meet my sister-in-law and her husband on Fri. July 22.  We leave on Sat. morning for Seattle, there we will embark for an Alaskan cruise on the Princess cruise line.  Yes, it's going to be a busy couple of weeks.  I've been trying to make sure we have clothes for all three events, and room to pack them all as we won't be home again until July 31th.  I'm sure that we will have a great time but trying to prepare for three completely different events is hair-raising!!!  But, just glad that I finally have hair to raise!!! HA HA  When, I return it's back to school on Monday.  Bummer!!! But glad that I am facing a new school year without chemo treatments this year!!!!
Posts.Title: Gone for a couple of weeks!
Finally saw the doc....

Posts.Content: We now have another angel in heaven.  8 years ago, I met Gwen, she was 61 at the time and had just been diagnosed with bc.  She was very impressed with my curls (chemo curls) and was waiting to begin chemo.  She told her doc that she wanted to look just like me when she was finished. HA  Unfortunately, she began to feel bad a few months ago.  They kept doing tests and couldn't find an answer.  She was taken to ER this past week and was diagnosed with leukemia the night before she died.  Say a prayer for her DH and family as they have lost a very sweet wife, mother and grandmother!

AgeInfo.Phrase: I met Gwen  she was 61 at the time and had

Posts.Title: GWEN

Posts.Content:
Yeah, it stinks doesn't it?  I've turned into a cancer hypochondriac... Every time, something new hurts (which isn't uncommon at 48) - I worry about
 cancer.  I even KNOW that I have arthritis in my knees and ankles and still when they hurt - which is which it rains or is very cold - I still think cancer first, arthritis second.  Oh well, think of it this way, other people could be walking around with cancer and not knowing about
 it - we are always being checked and staying on top of our situations.  Don't know if that's a good thing, always but there it is......

AgeInfo.Phrase:
hurts  which isn't uncommon at 48    I worry about
 cancer <Z>

Posts.Title: PET Scan Results

Posts.Content: I, too, had a reaction to Taxotere.  I ran a fever and my feet and legs were very swollen.  They counteracted by giving the Benadryl and doubled the courtesteroids that they give you before you take the Taxotere.  It meant more weight gain but I handled the Taxotere a lot better.  I hope she is feeling better soon.
Posts.Title: Cathi was admitted again!
Snufflesmom
Got the dreaded Tamoxifen prescription today

Posts.Content:
Will be praying on the 15th for GOOD NEWS!  While I have had bc twice, my s-i-l has been called in twice after her annual mammos and there was nothing wrong.  But, it's good that they actually were diligent when they saw something unusual.  Unfortunately, they read my mammo as normal in Jan. 2004 and then blood work in Feb. 2004 showed elevated tumor markers which eventually led to tests that confirmed recurrence.  Don't worry, too much, until you have something to worry about
.  It's hard to do, I'm a die-hard worrier but it doesn't change the outcome or make things any better so enjoy each day and then after the test - hopefully, you can go out and celebrate the GOOD NEWS!!!  LET US KNOW!!!
Posts.Title: Bad Mammo-Scared w/ ?'s

Posts.Content: Tell your family.  Everything that happens to us isn't cancer.....remember that!!!  I know the fear that living with having had cancer is like but stress can do so much and mimic many diseases.  Your family would want to know, trust me.  Also, if you go have it checked out now and nothing is wrong - imagine how good you will feel.  If something by chance is going on, it can be treated IF you let someone know and do what you can do to find out what's going on.
Posts.Title: Advice... worried.

Posts.Content: I am so glad that your PET scan results were normal!  It feels great to be called "normal" doesn't it?  As for the other, keep in touch with you gyn.  The change in my periods began after chemo and then finished completely with the Tamoxifen.  I don't remember if you had chemo or not but all that medicine that we have to take can bring on a change in periods, according to my onc and gyn.  Thankfully, I had few problems and now have no period which is great.  ( I used to have major cramps, etc.)  I'm like you, I'd wait until the kids were back in school before doing anything.  Enjoy your summer as best as you can.  Let the other wait, if you can.
Posts.Title: Bone Scan Results

Posts.Content:
What you are feeling is perfectly normal.  I just finished a little over a year of surgeries, chemo, etc.  I had my checkup on Tuesday and was called on Thursday or Friday that blood work and tumor markers were normal.  I immediately went into a funk.  I was so depressed all weekend.  I feel better today and don't go back for 3 more months.  But I thought about
 it - for the past year I've been doing everything the onc knows to get me well.  Now all that is over and it's just the Femara and 3 month check ups.  It's kinda scary like now I'm not doing anything to stay well. Also, I think you're so busy coping that when it's all over, it finally REALLY hits you that you've had cancer.  I thought I had dealt with it before but I was focused on the surgery, chemo and then reconstruction.  Now that's all behind me and I can be kinda normal and it scared me...Don't be hard on yourself, bc is not fun and it's okay to have some bad days.  Just don't let it take all the fun out of your life.  I've decided I can be pretty scary too - WATCH OUT CANCER!!!!!  ha ha
Posts.Title: Feeling depressed......

Posts.Content:
I, too, am dubious about
 the Health News.  Remember when aspirin lowered your risk of bc?  Well, I could have told them that was false.  I've taken Goody's forever (bad for your stomach, I know) and I had bc twice.  I've also taken a lot of ibuprofen.  Still had bc.  I guess maybe they really "don't know" how to prevent it.  
    Just wish they would keep there little theories to themselves until proven....but oh well.
Posts.Title: Acid Reflux..the latest
Well meaning family and friends????

Posts.Content: I am scheduled to begin that on June 22nd.  He will sew the skin around to make the nipples?  The nurse told me to expect them to be too big as they will be swollen and will shrink and then I will need a tattoo.  Gosh, it's much easier just being born with them, isn't it?  How many of you have done this?  Does it hurt?  Also, is it worth the trouble?  I think my DH wants me to do this as I will finally look normal - not for him, but for MY self-esteem.  He just wants me alive but he knows that I have self-esteem issues with the way my chest has looked since my first cancer in 1996.  Not that anyone else has seen it, but I know, ya know what I mean?
Posts.Title: Nipple reconstruction
Nipple reconstruction

Posts.Content:
My DH and I discussed this issue and decided to wait a while.  I want to enjoy my week at the beach and on the cruise.  Last year, I was at the beach with NO chest and that could be embarassing.  I had prothesis' but they kinda made the swimsuit hang down and show the space between.  At this point, I have a chest and cleavage.  I'd rather decide about
 the other after my trips.  I think I will be happier than rushing to get finished.
Posts.Title: Nipple reconstruction

Posts.Content: Great News!!!  I hope that little tumor marker stays low for you!!!
Posts.Title: Fantastic news!!!
Viagra/Cialis

Posts.Content: Great new!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I know you are so relieved!!!
Posts.Title: When waiting for your biopsy results did anyone...(Updated)

Posts.Content: Thanks girls!  I'll look for you on Monday!!!  I'll be wearing pink pajamas when it's over!!!
Posts.Title: PCE
menapause and breast cancer
Well meaning family and friends????
menapause and breast cancer
Chemo Cocktail

Posts.Content: So sorry to hear that you didn't get great news but like everyone has said - treatable is good.  Your doctor is obviously on top of this and hopeful for another remission.  I will be praying for you daily - keep us updated.
Posts.Title: CT Scan Results
Last Radiation Treatment Today!!

Posts.Content: Don't know what drugs you are on but I had my chemo on Mon. or Tues.'s and by Thursday - I always was running a temp and felt like I had the flu - multiple aches and pains - and extremely worn out.  The first treatment was the worst - I seemed to get over it quicker with most of the others.  Maybe that will help, maybe not.  Always tell you onc!
Posts.Title: Prayers please
Tumor Markers-what levels are normal and is this reliable
Your Experience with Chemo

Posts.Content: Well, I had my last reconstruction surgery last Monday.  It went very well.  I am pleased with the results!  I have stitches taken out on Wed.  Had drain tube removed last Thursday.  So far, I am very happy with the surgery.  I am a bit smaller than I was B.C. which is a good thing.  I feel much better with a smaller chest and am on a diet have lost 13 pounds so waist is looking better.  I have my next onc visit on 6/14 so send up prayers.  I don't expect any bad news just a regular checkup but then  I never expected to have cancer once, much less twice....
Posts.Title: Reconstruction

Posts.Content: Will be praying!!!!!  Good luck!!!
Posts.Title: Asking for some hand holding from the PCE
DRAINS - how to deal with THEM!!!!

Posts.Content: I took Tamoxifen for 5 years.  I had a period off and on for a couple of years but since then - not a one in years.  I think I was around 40 when I started taking it.  NO period is NOT bad news!

AgeInfo.Phrase: I think I was around 40 when I started taking it

Posts.Title: Today I find out if it is Cancer or B9
dose dense chemo

Posts.Content: I am having my last reconstructive surgery on Monday 5-23.  If any of you can slip a pink boa this way, I would appreciate it.  That will complete my surgeries.  I pray now for only good news in the future.
Posts.Title: PCE
Hair is falling out...........

Posts.Content: The first time I had chemo (9 years ago) was pretty rough.  When I had it last year, it was a lot better.  I'm not saying it's fun, it's not, but it's a lot more doable than it used to be.  There are some really good drugs out there now that help you to get thru it.  Will be praying hard for you!!!
Posts.Title: afraid of chemo
sore mouth
Wigs

Posts.Content:
The best place I found for wigs was 
.  I had two wigs from their - even my onc thought it was my hair!
Posts.Title: Wigs
Hair is falling out...........
new here with questions

Posts.Content: Never had a needle biopsy but will be praying for an easy one for you and good results!!!!
Posts.Title: new here with questions

Posts.Content: I took Tamoxifen for 5 years.  It wasn't so bad.  I did gain weight and had hot flashes.  They gave me Effexor which helped the hot flashes tremendously.  I have not had a period since and really don't miss it a bit.  I was 38 when I was first diagnosed -it is a shock!!!  You take it for 5 years.  Now I am on Letrozole (Femara) which you also take for 5 years.  They have started giving this after you finish Tamoxifen.  Anything that helps fight cancer - we'll go for it!

AgeInfo.Phrase: <Z> <Z> <Z> I was 38 when I was first diagnosed

Posts.Title: Atypical Lobular Hyperplasia

Posts.Content: Will keep you and your family in our prayers.  And yes, we all do a lot of worrying don't we?  I guess you finally get used to it.  I find myself worrying about little things - like walk a couple of miles and then wonder why my legs are sore?!?  You do have better days though.  There are some days now that I don't worry about anything at all (healthwise) and others when the least little thing makes me want to scream!!!!  That could mean I'm a female over 40 though and have nothing to do with BC. HA  Oh well, whatever, it is good to be alive!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Posts.Title: need some help,please

Posts.Content: I would agree with the other advice.  Biopsy is the only way to know for sure.  I had a lump that they said was more than likely benign - come back in 6 months.  I did and ended up with a mastectomy and 4 positive lymph nodes.  Better safe than sorry!!!!!!!  Good luck and tell your doctor you want to know for SURE!!!
Posts.Title: Swollen Lymph Node in Mammogram
Here we go again......

Posts.Content: Sorry you have had to join us on this board.  It's really not a club you want to join but you will be encouraged from the stories and advice you get here.  I was first diagnosed at 38.  Surgery, chemo, it's all something you CAN do.  It's not fun by any means but you'll be amazed at how well you handle it.  Keep a good support group - only hang around POSITIVE people(this one is very important) and keep your humor.  Let us know how you're doing.  We are all praying for negative nodes!!!!! (but, if they are not, YOU CAN STILL MAKE IT!!!)

AgeInfo.Phrase: I was first diagnosed at 38   Surgery  chemo  it's all

Posts.Title: Newly Diagnosed
tkng...

Posts.Content: Has anyone out there that did the reconstruction ever had trouble with itching?  I remember having some problems the first time but it might be under my arm or somewhere else.  Today, one of the twins has gone thru spells of itching like crazy.  Scratching doesn't help!!!!  I see plastic surgeon again on Wed. for another expansion and I guess I'll see what he has to say.  But, if anyone on here has any advice - please, please, please let me know.
Posts.Title: Twins

Posts.Content: Just wanted to say the "twins" were born on Wednesday.  Surgery went well but two different nurses gave me meperghan? and that's not a good thing.  I was being walked around, given Narcon and other meds to wake me up.  Can you believe it?  OH well, the twins weren't affected and I predict I will be very satisfied with them.  It will be a while before I have a nice size chest and more hair but that day is coming.  I told my friends that I foresee a lowcut shirt in the future.  She suggested a nice diamond to lay in just the right place.  HA!  Of couse, after all my medical bills, a diamond is out of the question, but cubic zirconia sounds okay.   Oh well, one day at a time...glad for each day. Hope this proves to be a good New Year for all of you!!!  I know the disase is always on  our mind but we are SURVIVORS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Posts.Title: TWINS

Posts.Content: The first time I had a drain tube taken out - ouch!!!!!! I was so glad it was in my surgeon's office because I figured he'd had to sew me back together. HA HA  The second time I had tubes out I was still in hospital and the nurse let me know when the surgeon was coming down the hall.  Did I ever push the button on my pain pump!!!!!!!!!!  HA HA
Posts.Title: hey guys
More good news!
Tests all done, now I wait....

Posts.Content: Can't dance very well but I'm jumping up and down for you!!!!!  Don't you love the B-9 word?!?!?!!
Posts.Title: Results are IN!

Posts.Content: Twins are still doing well.  They still make me ache a little but oh well, so do my three sons at times. HA Ha  Will keep you posted on their development!
Posts.Title: TWINS
nervous about tomorrow's chemo
thanks & surgery happy drs?
Anyone on Doxil?

Posts.Content: So glad that you're first chemo went well!!!!  I hope every one of the others goes the same!!!
Posts.Title: chemo went great

Posts.Content: Wait for the doctor's report.  Yes, it is hard but every cyst is Not cancer and You Can be one of the lucky ones.  Try to keep a positive attitude and Expect the Best!!!!!!
Posts.Title: Cysts / Painful breasts
Ok, time to dust off your psych degrees...
Yoohoo! for benign results!!!
Paper's done
just checking in
just checking in

Posts.Content: Losing the hair is very hard.  The first time I had cancer, it was devastating.  This time, I decided when to shave my head.  I handled that well because I was in control of the situation.  My boys called my GI Jane and I survived it.  It's starting to grow back now, slowly but surely.  So remember, this too will pass.  Just take charge of the situation and do it your own way, that makes you comfortable.
Posts.Title: Losing hair......

Posts.Content: To Port or not to Port - that is the question.  I have had cancer twice.  First time, no port.  Second time - port.  I have to say that the port has been a life saver for ME.  My veins aren't much good and it makes things a lot easier, but you should go with your heart.  I didn't want a port but am so thankful for it now.  My surgeon also says it can be taken out in the office now with a medication to numb the area.  I think I'll keep it a while longer.
Posts.Title: tests and surgery
good news
Emotional response to bi-lateral mastectomies

Posts.Content: Sorry, I haven't posted much.  Christmas is wild around here with my three sons!!! I'm loving every minute of it.  Funny how the big C makes you appreciate each and every moment with yout family!!! (It's almost worth it - but not quite - know what I mean?)  I had to have a colonoscopy on Tuesday.  It scared the crap (literally, sorry) out of me but my reports were GREAT!!!!!!  I was so relieved!  I begin my reconstruction on Wed. in Jacksonville.  I really can't wait!  Told my mom that I was having "twins" on Wednesday!!!  HA HA  It will be nice to feel halfway normal.  Although, normal is never a word I'll use about myself again.  Survivor, warrior, etc....but normal?  I don't think so!!!
Posts.Title: Merry Christmas!!!
TWINS

Posts.Content: Guess I was a little late with my response.  Sorry, I've been busy having "twins"!  Starting to feel better and can't wait to see the final result!
Posts.Title: tests and surgery

Posts.Content: I hate to hear that other's feel like I do with all the aches and pains but it's nice to know that it's pretty normal for us.  I was beginning to worry that I had bone cancer or something - although my PET was normal and blood work was normal....  I appreciate everyone sharing their experiences - it makes it a lot easier to cope.
Posts.Title: new to message board, need to vent.............

Posts.Content: One thing that I really appreciated was POSITIVE support.  I had some very good friends who were NEVER negative about my illness and were very upbeat about my ability to get thru it.  Of course, there were some who would act like I was dying, even though I had a good pathology report.  They would be so sad and depressed.  I had one friend who always wanted to come "sit" with me....I was always on my way to my youngest son's baseball game!  I told my DH that I wasn't in hospice - I was going to LIVE and enjoy my time here!!!  BTW, his team won the State Championship for their division this summer!!!!!!!! and I didn't miss a game!  Treat her like she is NORMAL and is going to get thru it.  Also, one of my favorite gifts was a gift certificate for a manicure and a pedicure...pamper, pamper, pamper!!!!!!
Posts.Title: my friend just found out
Chemo starting
blindsided by first mammo
Emotional response to bi-lateral mastectomies

Posts.Content: I am also taking Femara.  Haven't asked or looked up side effects of that..... Yes, I'm sure this is what a senior citizen feels like - if not, and it gets worse - God Help Us All!!!!! HA HA
Posts.Title: new to message board, need to vent.............
Tamoxifen question
side effects of tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Know how you feel.  I was misdiagnosed in 1996 with a fibroadenoma and left to wait six months until left breast had a ripple in it and 3 lymph nodes were cancerous.  Then, after all that, my mammograms were misread for 4 years.  Just had mammogram in Feb., read as normal, tumor marker up at end of Feb., PET scan showed the tumor under right arm.  You'd think they'd try to get it right ONCE in awhile!  No, I won't have any scans read here in my hometown anymore.
Posts.Title: new to message board, need to vent.............

Posts.Content: Hi Undefeated,
Posts.Title: new to message board, need to vent.............

Posts.Content: Just got back from onc.  PET scan is NORMAL!!!!!!!!!  Blood work is normal!!!
Posts.Title: GREAT NEWS!!!!

Posts.Content: I am so sorry that you are still sick!  I will be praying for you during this difficult time.  I know that our DH's mean well but sometimes they come across the wrong way.  Mine was angry with me yesterday for being so nervous before I saw the onc and found out my PET scan was normal.  I finally yelled at him and told him that he wasn't in MY shoes and he didn't really know how HE would handle it.  I think he kind of took that in. He really tries to be there for me.  He's cleaned the house and cooked most meals, washed most of the clothes since April 19th when I had mast. and then thru the chemo.  DH's get upset because it's not them and they really want to do more and they are limited.  They're not GOD....I know they mean well - they want to make this go away and they can't.  Oh well, enough defending the men.  Hang in there girl!!!  You are a survivor!!!! YOU CAN DO THIS!!!!  Know that you are in a lot of thoughts and prayers!
Posts.Title: Please make this nausea go away!!!!

Posts.Content: I will be praying for you.  I've just finished my chemo.  It sucks but it's what we do to survive and fight this evil disease!!!  You CAN do it!  We will all be here for you to talk whenever you need and will be constantly praying!
Posts.Title: Masectomy done, chemo ahead

Posts.Content: Tking, 47, from GA.  1st diagnosed in 1996, 2nd in 2004.  Just finished chemo last Tuesday.
Posts.Title: ROLL CALL name, age, state and any other info to share

Posts.Content: I'm on my way to onc at 3:00 to do blood work and get results of PET scan.  My blood work has been good and onc expects good results but my last PET led to 6 tx of Taxotere and Adriamyacin so I'm scared.  I know the drugs and docs have done their job.  Pray for my nerves - I hate getting reports.  I'm relieved when they're good but until I get them - I'M SCARED!!!!!  Sorry to be a baby.

AgeInfo.Phrase: my way to onc at 3 00 to do blood work

Posts.Title: Scared stiff

Age.Phrase: <Z> <Z> <Z> I was 38 when I was first diagnosed
